definition: ticket/ballot/banknote/CL:張|张[zhang1]/person held for ransom/amateur performance of Chinese opera/classifier for groups, batches, business transactions

sentences.english: A short seller bets that a stock price will fall.
sentences.chinese: 有一個空頭押注該公司股票價格將下跌。

sentences.english: Passengers traveling on the line pay 555 yuan for a one-way, economy-class ticket between Beijing and Shanghai.
sentences.chinese: 京滬高鐵單程二等座的票價爲555元。

sentences.english: The charge for a front-row seat is $ 3.
sentences.chinese: 前排座位票價每張三美元。

sentences.english: They raised the price of a one way lift ticket from $24 to $26.
sentences.chinese: 他們把纜車單程票價從24美元漲到26美元。

sentences.english: You promise yourself that you will sell when the price gets to $20.
sentences.chinese: 你自我許諾在股票價格到達20元時就賣掉它。
歐洲迪斯尼的股票價格迅速上漲了17便士。

sentences.english: Fares are valid on Greyhound schedules and those of participating interline carriers.
sentences.chinese: 該票價在灰狗和那些參加聯營的運營計劃內有效。

sentences.english: Only one-third of the price is required of the student body.
sentences.chinese: 上海公安博物館對學生團體實行三分之一票價。

sentences.english: Watching movies is fun, but the ticket prices never go down.
sentences.chinese: 看電影真愉快，可惜票價下不來。

sentences.english: Press the amount you have to pay, insert your coins, and the ticket will come out.
sentences.chinese: 按下妳要買的票價，投入零錢，票就會跑出來了。

sentences.english: What's the fare from Jingmei to Danshui?
sentences.chinese: 坐捷運從景美到淡水的票價是多少？
股票價格大約比現價晚20分鐘。

sentences.english: Having the ability to overbook means that the airlines can keep fares lower.
sentences.chinese: 超額預定機票可以使航空公司將票價定得低些。

sentences.english: Free for individual primary and middle school student. (Visitor Ticket of Guangzhou Patriotism Education Base is required. )
sentences.chinese: 中小學生個人憑學生證按票價五折優惠。

sentences.english: Holiday travel market cooling, domestic air fares in advance "high platform diving."
sentences.chinese: 假期旅遊市場降溫，國內機票價格提前“高臺跳水”。

sentences.english: But scalpers said that weekend prices are higher and holiday-time prices will go through the roof.
sentences.chinese: 可是黃牛說週末價錢更高，假期票價將會高入雲霄。

definition: to buy tickets/(Tw) to buy votes (in an election)
to set a price/to fix a price
to agree/to conclude/to draw up/to subscribe to (a newspaper etc)/to order
to transfer/to change trains, buses etc
